p.span: The formulas below are the case of Central impact (velocity vectors coincide with the line connecting the centers of objects), however, this is not the only case of impact on the plane. Most often there is a place to be a non-Central blow. In such cases, you must enter a new coordinate system where the coordinate axis connects the centers of the features. Next, you need to find the velocity projections of objects on the axis of the new coordinate system. The idea is to go back to the particular case of collision, the Central collision. Projections on the Y-axis are calculated using the above formulas, while projections on the X-axis remain unchanged, they do not participate in the collision.

p.span: 1. A large inaccuracy in the calculations:

for competent calculation of new speeds after collisions it is necessary to make transfers from one coordinate system to another that is inseparably connected with manipulations over corners, and also application of functions cos(), sin(), atan(). The accuracy of these functions is not too high, so the speeds have tiny errors that are invisible for small periods of time, but when accumulated can lead to very noticeable incorrect results.
